crawlerobo writes:
> I need Character code conversion from Shift_JIS to EUC_JP.

When do you need this to be done? Do you want the crawler to do it? Or
do you want to post-process the documents in an ARC file? Or is this
unrelated to Heritrix at all?

If you are doing it inside of Heritrix then you can use the Java
transcoders. Again, you need to know that the documenting you are
converting is actually in Shift JIS though.

> I used nkf(network kanji filter).

I've never used it.

What operating system are you on? On Linux, FreeBSD, and Mac OS X you
can use the 'iconv' command to do the conversion for you:

% iconv -f shift_jis -t euc-jp infile > outfile

I don't know if there is a command-line transcoder publically
available on Windows. Certainly iconv can be built under cygwin.

> Bat becomes an error.(maybe gif/jpeg code)

Or it could be an extension to Shift JIS, like Microsoft's CP932. Or
it could be Chinese text. Or it could be Korean text... do you even
know that the document you are converting is in Shift JIS?
